perturbation.original_text:
Party B shall purchase sufficient insurance for the transportation vehicles. The coverage of third-party liability insurance shall not be lower than
RMB1 million. In addition to vehicle personnel insurance, Party B shall at least purchase injury insurance for two persons with coverage
not lower than RMB500,000 per person. Party B shall bear any consequence arising out of the non-compliance of insurance purchase, and
Party A shall have no liability.
perturbation.changed_text: Party B shall purchase insurance for the transportation vehicles. Party B shall bear any consequence arising out of the non-compliance of insurance purchase, and Party A shall have no liability.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of the specific insurance coverage requirements for third-party liability (RMB1 million) and injury insurance (RMB500,000 per person) creates a legal risk. Chinese law mandates minimum insurance coverage amounts for commercial transportation based on the potential liabilities. By removing these specific minimums, the contract becomes potentially non-compliant and shifts the risk entirely to Party B, which may not be legally permissible.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Regulations on Road Transportation of Dangerous Goods (中华人民共和国道路危险货物运输管理规定) and related regulations in China specifying minimum insurance requirements for transportation companies.
